documentation:
Use AWS Resource Access Manager to share AWS resources between AWS accounts. To share a resource, you create a resource share, associate the resource with the resource share, and specify the principals that can access the resources associated with the resource share. The following principals are supported: AWS accounts, organizational units (OU) from AWS Organizations, and organizations from AWS Organizations.

For more information, see the AWS Resource Access Manager User Guide.

AcceptResourceShareInvitation.documentation: Accepts an invitation to a resource share from another AWS account.
AcceptResourceShareInvitation.name: AcceptResourceShareInvitation

AssociateResourceShare.documentation: Associates the specified resource share with the specified principals and resources.
AssociateResourceShare.name: AssociateResourceShare

AssociateResourceSharePermission.documentation: Associates a permission with a resource share.
AssociateResourceSharePermission.name: AssociateResourceSharePermission

DisassociateResourceShare.documentation: Disassociates the specified principals or resources from the specified resource share.
DisassociateResourceShare.name: DisassociateResourceShare

DisassociateResourceSharePermission.documentation: Disassociates an AWS RAM permission from a resource share.
DisassociateResourceSharePermission.name: DisassociateResourceSharePermission

EnableSharingWithAwsOrganization.documentation:
Enables resource sharing within your AWS Organization.

The caller must be the master account for the AWS Organization.
EnableSharingWithAwsOrganization.name: EnableSharingWithAwsOrganization

GetPermission.documentation: Gets the contents of an AWS RAM permission in JSON format.
GetPermission.name: GetPermission

GetResourcePolicies.documentation: Gets the policies for the specified resources that you own and have shared.
GetResourcePolicies.name: GetResourcePolicies

GetResourceShareAssociations.documentation: Gets the resources or principals for the resource shares that you own.
GetResourceShareAssociations.name: GetResourceShareAssociations

GetResourceShareInvitations.documentation: Gets the invitations for resource sharing that you've received.
GetResourceShareInvitations.name: GetResourceShareInvitations

GetResourceShares.documentation: Gets the resource shares that you own or the resource shares that are shared with you.
GetResourceShares.name: GetResourceShares

ListPendingInvitationResources.documentation: Lists the resources in a resource share that is shared with you but that the invitation is still pending for.
ListPendingInvitationResources.name: ListPendingInvitationResources

ListPrincipals.documentation: Lists the principals that you have shared resources with or that have shared resources with you.
ListPrincipals.name: ListPrincipals

ListResourceSharePermissions.documentation: Lists the AWS RAM permissions that are associated with a resource share.
ListResourceSharePermissions.name: ListResourceSharePermissions

ListResources.documentation: Lists the resources that you added to a resource shares or the resources that are shared with you.
ListResources.name: ListResources

PromoteResourceShareCreatedFromPolicy.documentation:
Resource shares that were created by attaching a policy to a resource are visible only to the resource share owner, and the resource share cannot be modified in AWS RAM.

Use this API action to promote the resource share. When you promote the resource share, it becomes:

  • Visible to all principals that it is shared with.

  • Modifiable in AWS RAM.
PromoteResourceShareCreatedFromPolicy.name: PromoteResourceShareCreatedFromPolicy

RejectResourceShareInvitation.documentation: Rejects an invitation to a resource share from another AWS account.
RejectResourceShareInvitation.name: RejectResourceShareInvitation

TagResource.documentation: Adds the specified tags to the specified resource share that you own.
TagResource.name: TagResource

UntagResource.documentation: Removes the specified tags from the specified resource share that you own.
UntagResource.name: UntagResource

UpdateResourceShare.documentation: Updates the specified resource share that you own.
UpdateResourceShare.name: UpdateResourceShare

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next page of results.

policies.documentation: A key policy document, in JSON format.

associationType.documentation: The association type. Specify PRINCIPAL to list the principals that are associated with the specified resource share. Specify RESOURCE to list the resources that are associated with the specified resource share.

IdempotentParameterMismatchException.documentation: A client token input parameter was reused with an operation, but at least one of the other input parameters is different from the previous call to the operation.

InvalidMaxResultsException.documentation: The specified value for MaxResults is not valid.

InvalidNextTokenException.documentation: The specified value for NextToken is not valid.

InvalidResourceTypeException.documentation: The specified resource type is not valid.

InvalidStateTransitionException.documentation: The requested state transition is not valid.

MalformedArnException.documentation: The format of an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) is not valid.

Principal.documentation: Describes a principal for use with AWS Resource Access Manager.

creationTime.documentation: The time when the principal was associated with the resource share.

external.documentation: Indicates whether the principal belongs to the same AWS organization as the AWS account that owns the resource share.

lastUpdatedTime.documentation: The time when the association was last updated.

resourceShareArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource share.
The ARN of the resource share to promote.

resourceShareInvitationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the invitation.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

Resource.documentation: Describes a resource associated with a resource share.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

creationTime.documentation: The time when the resource was associated with the resource share.

lastUpdatedTime.documentation: The time when the association was last updated.

resourceGroupArn.documentation: The ARN of the resource group. This value is returned only if the resource is a resource group.

resourceShareArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource share.

statusMessage.documentation: A message about the status of the resource.

ResourceArnNotFoundException.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) was not found.

allowExternalPrincipals.documentation: Indicates whether principals outside your AWS organization can be associated with a resource share.

creationTime.documentation: The time when the resource share was created.

featureSet.documentation:
Indicates how the resource share was created. Possible values include:

  • CREATED_FROM_POLICY - Indicates that the resource share was created from an AWS Identity and Access Management (AWS IAM) policy attached to a resource. These resource shares are visible only to the AWS account that created it. They cannot be modified in AWS RAM.

  • PROMOTING_TO_STANDARD - The resource share is in the process of being promoted. For more information, see PromoteResourceShareCreatedFromPolicy.

  • STANDARD - Indicates that the resource share was created in AWS RAM using the console or APIs. These resource shares are visible to all principals. They can be modified in AWS RAM.

lastUpdatedTime.documentation: The time when the resource share was last updated.

owningAccountId.documentation: The ID of the AWS account that owns the resource share.

resourceShareArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource share.

statusMessage.documentation: A message about the status of the resource share.

ResourceShareAssociation.documentation: Describes an association with a resource share.

associatedEntity.documentation: The associated entity. For resource associations, this is the ARN of the resource. For principal associations, this is the ID of an AWS account or the ARN of an OU or organization from AWS Organizations.

creationTime.documentation: The time when the association was created.

external.documentation: Indicates whether the principal belongs to the same AWS organization as the AWS account that owns the resource share.

lastUpdatedTime.documentation: The time when the association was last updated.

resourceShareArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource share.

statusMessage.documentation: A message about the status of the association.

ResourceShareInvitation.documentation: Describes an invitation to join a resource share.

invitationTimestamp.documentation: The date and time when the invitation was sent.

receiverAccountId.documentation: The ID of the AWS account that received the invitation.

resourceShareArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource share.

resourceShareAssociations.deprecatedMessage: This member has been deprecated. Use ListPendingInvitationResources.
resourceShareAssociations.documentation: To view the resources associated with a pending resource share invitation, use ListPendingInvitationResources.

resourceShareInvitationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the invitation.

senderAccountId.documentation: The ID of the AWS account that sent the invitation.

ResourceShareInvitationArnNotFoundExcept.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an invitation was not found.

ResourceShareLimitExceededException.documentation: The requested resource share exceeds the limit for your account.

creationTime.documentation: The date and time when the permission was created.

defaultVersion.documentation: The identifier for the version of the permission that is set as the default version.

lastUpdatedTime.documentation: The date and time when the permission was last updated.

permission.documentation: The permission's effect and actions in JSON format. The effect indicates whether the actions are allowed or denied. The actions list the API actions to which the principal is granted or denied access.

resourceType.documentation: The resource type to which the permission applies.

version.documentation: The identifier for the version of the permission.

ResourceSharePermissionSummary.documentation: Information about a permission that is associated with a resource share.

creationTime.documentation: The date and time when the permission was created.

defaultVersion.documentation: The identifier for the version of the permission that is set as the default version.

lastUpdatedTime.documentation: The date and time when the permission was last updated.

resourceType.documentation: The type of resource to which the permission applies.

version.documentation: The identifier for the version of the permission.

ServerInternalException.documentation: The service could not respond to the request due to an internal problem.

TagFilter.documentation: Used to filter information based on tags.

TagLimitExceededException.documentation: The requested tags exceed the limit for your account.

TagPolicyViolationException.documentation: The specified tag is a reserved word and cannot be used.

resourceShareArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource share.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource share.

tagKeys.documentation: The tag keys of the tags to remove.

allowExternalPrincipals.documentation: Indicates whether principals outside your AWS organization can be associated with a resource share.
